TRIBE.Definition: a group of people in a traditional society sharing the same culture and history

SLAUGHTERING.Definition: killing a great number of people

FOLK HERO.Definition: a person who is greatly admired by many people of that place

TRIBES.Definition: groups of people in a traditional society sharing the same culture and history

RETREAT.Definition: go away in order to escape from danger

WITH ITS TAIL BETWEEN ITS LEGS.Definition: embarrassed or ashamed because they had been defeated

BE NO MATCH FOR.Definition: not able to compete successfully with

HORNS.Definition: wind instruments made from horns (a hard, pointed part that grows from the top of the head of some animals)

DIG UP.Definition: take out of the ground by digging

SOPHISTICATED.Definition: showing knowledge and a higher level of civilisation

DRUIDS.Definition: people with an important scientific and religious position in the Celtic community

CAPABLE.Definition: having the skills or power, able

WILL.Definition: legal document with instructions as to what should be done with his money and property after his death

UNSPEAKABLE.Definition: too bad and shocking to be expressed in words

FLOGGED.Definition: beaten with thick leather pieces or cords with lead balls or animals bones that created deep cuts

WHIPPED.Definition: beaten with thick leather pieces or cords with lead balls or animals bones that created deep cuts

CORDS.Definition: pieces of material twisted together, strings

ANCESTRAL.Definition: inherited or received from previous generations

FLOGGING.Definition: beating with with thick leather pieces or cords with lead balls or animals bones that created deep cuts

DRUID.Definition: someone with an important scientific and religious position in the Celtic community

SUMMONED.Definition: called them officially to be present in a meeting

INJUSTICE.Definition: a situation which was not fair or just

EMBALMED.Definition: preserved, kept in a good condition

SET FIRE TO IT.Definition: made it start buring, ignited it

MARCHED.Definition: walked in a steady military manner

HUMILIATING.Definition: making them lose respect for themselves

CONVINCED.Definition: made him do it by talking to him or persuaded him

ON THE VERGE OF.Definition: at the point when it was about to happen

OPPRESSED.Definition: governed in an unfair way, treated badly

SHIELDS.Definition: large objects made of metal or wood that soldiers held in their hand to protect themselves

CHAINMAIL.Definition: a kind of protective clothing (armour) that was made up of many tiny metal rings that were linked together

ARMOUR.Definition: strong protective covering for the body

MAKESHIFT.Definition: made out of whatever was available, of low quality

JAVELINS.Definition: long wooden weapons with a sharp metal point at one end

SPEARS.Definition: long wooden weapons with a sharp metal point at one end

STEEL.Definition: a strong metal consisting of iron and carbon

SWING.Definition: move from one side to the other

CLOSE COMBAT.Definition: the act of fighting at short range

RELY.Definition: be dependant on, place our confidence

TAKE THEM WITH A PINCH OF SALT.Definition: not believe that they are completely accurate or true

HARSH.Definition: rough, hard, not soft or smooth

BROOCH.Definition: a small piece of jewellery with a pin

BACKHANDED.Definition: pleasant but also containing criticism or sarcasm

ROUSING.Definition: making people feeling excited and ready to take action, inspiring

COMMANDERS.Definition: officers or leaders in charge of a military operation

INTO THE PUBLIC EYE.Definition: in the attention of the general public

EMPOWERMENT.Definition: the process of becoming stronger and more confident

WITNESS.Definition: see her in the place or setting in which she lived

CHARIOT.Definition: a two-wheeled vehicle pulled by horses
